channel.title: What is up with this?
channel.description:
okay well i got java jre1.6.0_06 and it says [code]The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
This is my compiler [code]@echo off COLOR 08 title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/code]

item.title: What is up with this?
item.dc:creator: @ibby ibby
item.description:
@ibby wrote:

no nuts u need jdk not jre nuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuu

Read full topic

item.title: What is up with this?
item.dc:creator: @lolvengeance lolvengeance
item.description:
@lolvengeance wrote:

bad compiler maybe? click edit and replace ur code with this
@echo off
title Compiler
echo Auorin’s Compiler
echo Created by The Hidd3n
echo ________________________________________________________________________________
color 0a
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit
check ur enviroment variables are right

Read full topic

item.title: What is up with this?
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

i downloaded Java EE 5 SDK Update 5 (with JDK 6u6)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 09, 2008, 02:24:56 AM[/size][hr]And i can run clients and servers but just not compile

Read full topic

item.title: What is up with this?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

You said you have jre1.6.0_06. If that’s the only thing you have, you also need the JDK.

Read full topic

item.title: What is up with this?
item.dc:creator: @Vesnal1 Vesnal1
item.description:
@Vesnal1 wrote:

Do you have the classpaths set? And do you have jdk 6 or a earlier version, if that is the case you will need to change the

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

to

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_XX\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

The xx is the version you have, so if you had 06 it would be _06 or if you had 5 it would be 05

Read full topic
